text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSLaboratoryObservation

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSLaboratoryObservation 0..*EHDSObservationLaboratory observation model

Elements defined in Ancestors:header, observationDate[x], code, name, originalName, method, specimen, order, performer[x], anatomicLocation, result, dataAbsentReason, referenceRange, interpretation, resultDescription, component, derivedFrom[x], triggeredBy[x], hasMember[x]
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
code 1..1CodeableConceptObservation code
Binding Description: (preferred): LOINC, NPU
testKit 0..1EHDSDeviceLaboratory test kit used during measurement.
calibrator 0..1IdentifierInformation about which end-user calibrator the laboratory used for the measurement to indicate the metrological traceability chain.
accreditationStatus 0..1booleanAccreditation status of the laboratory for the observation.
previousResults 0..*EHDSLaboratoryObservationPrevious results of the same observation
pointOfCareTest 0..1booleanExamination performed near or at the site of a patient.

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSLaboratoryObservation
title: Laboratory observation model
description: EHDS refined base model for Observation performed by laboratory

element.short: Laboratory observation model
element.definition: EHDS refined base model for Observation performed by laboratory

element.short: Common header for all patient-related data
element.definition: Common header for all patient-related data

element.short: Patient who is receiving health care. This patient might be different from the direct subject of the observation.
element.definition: Patient/subject information

element.short: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).
element.definition: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).

element.short: Resource authoring details. Multiple authors can be provided.
element.definition: Resource authoring details. Multiple authors can be provided.

element.short: Author responsible for the provided information. The exact role of the responsible author varies across use cases and is often specified in individual models.
element.definition: Author responsible for the provided information. The exact role of the responsible author varies across use cases and is often specified in individual models.

element.short: Date and time of authoring/issuing
element.definition: Date and time of authoring/issuing

element.short: Status of the resource or document
element.definition: Status of the resource or document

element.short: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.
element.definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

element.short: The direct subject of the observation if different from the patient (subject of care), e.g. an observation of an implanted device
element.definition: The direct subject of the observation if different from the patient (subject of care), e.g. an observation of an implanted device

element.short: Clinically relevant time or time period for the observation
element.definition: Clinically relevant time or time period for the observation

element.short: Observation code
element.definition: Code representing the observation using the agreed code systems.

element.short: Name of the observation
element.definition: Name of the observation

element.short: Original (conventional) name of the observation
element.definition: Original (conventional) name of the observation

element.short: Observation method
element.definition: Observation method (measurement principle) to obtain the result.

element.short: Specimen used for this observation.
element.definition: Specimen used for this observation.

element.short: Identifies order and order placer this observation belongs to
element.definition: Identifies order and order placer this observation belongs to

element.short: Performer of the observation. Some test could be performed by the patient himself or by a care giver. Those are in the scope of this deliverable under specified conditions.
element.definition: Performer of the observation. Some test could be performed by the patient himself or by a care giver. Those are in the scope of this deliverable under specified conditions.

element.short: Anatomic location and laterality where the observation was performed.
element.definition: Anatomic location and laterality where the observation was performed.

element.short: Result of the observation including text, numeric and coded results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.
element.definition: Result of the observation including text, numeric and coded results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.

element.short: Observation result value according to the type of observation.
element.definition: Observation result value according to the type of observation.

element.short: Observation result value as a text. Should be used only if coded result value is not expected otherwise use valueCodeableConcept.text.
element.definition: Observation result value as a text. Should be used only if coded result value is not expected otherwise use valueCodeableConcept.text.

element.short: Observation result value as a quantity, result units of the measurement should be provided.
element.definition: Observation result value as a quantity, result units of the measurement should be provided.

element.short: Observation result value as a range (open or closed). Result units of the measurement should be provided.
element.definition: Observation result value as a range (open or closed). Result units of the measurement should be provided.

element.short: Observation result value from a valid code system
element.definition: Observation result value from a valid code system

example.label: coded result
example.valueString: For example this could be a code describing identified bacteria or other microorganism identified, description of urinary concernment, jaundice (hyperbilirubinemia), scoring (GCS), etc.

element.short: Measurement uncertainty type and interval if needed.
element.definition: Measurement uncertainty type and interval if needed.

element.short: Measurement uncertainty type and interval if needed.
element.definition: Measurement uncertainty type and interval if needed.

element.short: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.
element.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

element.short: Reference range, multiple reference ranges of different types culd by provided. Provides guide for interpretation of result.
element.definition: Reference range, multiple reference ranges of different types culd by provided. Provides guide for interpretation of result.
element.comment: Reference ranges are usually implied only for a numeric scale type. Use of the same units for reference range and value is implied.

element.short: Information about reference intervals and result interpretation.
element.definition: Information about reference intervals and result interpretation.

element.short: Comments and narrative representation of the observation result and findings.
element.definition: Comments and narrative representation of the observation result and findings.

element.short: Component in case the observation consists of multiple sub-observations (e.g. blood pressure).
element.definition: Component in case the observation consists of multiple sub-observations (e.g. blood pressure).

element.short: Code representing the observation using the agreed code systems.
element.definition: Code representing the observation using the agreed code systems.

element.short: Original (conventional) name of the observation
element.definition: Original (conventional) name of the observation

element.short: Result of the observation including text, numeric and coded results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.
element.definition: Result of the observation including text, numeric and coded results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.

element.short: Observation result value according to the type of observation.
element.definition: Observation result value according to the type of observation.

element.short: Observation result value as a text. Should be used only if coded result value is not expected otherwise use valueCodeableConcept.text.
element.definition: Observation result value as a text. Should be used only if coded result value is not expected otherwise use valueCodeableConcept.text.

element.short: Observation result value as a quantity, result units of the measurement should be provided.
element.definition: Observation result value as a quantity, result units of the measurement should be provided.

element.short: Observation result value as a range (open or closed). Result units of the measurement should be provided.
element.definition: Observation result value as a range (open or closed). Result units of the measurement should be provided.

element.short: Observation result value from a valid code system
element.definition: Observation result value from a valid code system

element.short: Measurement uncertainty type and interval if needed.
element.definition: Measurement uncertainty type and interval if needed.

element.short: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.
element.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

element.short: Reference range, multiple reference ranges of different types culd by provided. Provides guide for interpretation of result.
element.definition: Reference range, multiple reference ranges of different types culd by provided. Provides guide for interpretation of result.
element.comment: Reference ranges are usually implied only for a numeric scale type. Use of the same units for reference range and value is implied.

element.short: Information about reference intervals and result interpretation.
element.definition: Information about reference intervals and result interpretation.

element.short: Reference to the related resource from which the observation has been made. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.
element.definition: Reference to the related resource from which the observation has been made. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

element.short: References to the observation(s) that triggered the performance of this observation.
element.definition: References to the observation(s) that triggered the performance of this observation.

element.short: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.
element.definition: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

element.short: Laboratory test kit used during measurement.
element.definition: Laboratory test kit used during measurement.

element.short: Information about which end-user calibrator the laboratory used for the measurement to indicate the metrological traceability chain.
element.definition: Information about which end-user calibrator the laboratory used for the measurement to indicate the metrological traceability chain.

element.short: Accreditation status of the laboratory for the observation.
element.definition: Accreditation status of the laboratory for the observation.

element.short: Previous results of the same observation
element.definition: Previous results of the same observation

element.short: Examination performed near or at the site of a patient.
element.definition: Indicates if the observation is a point-of-care test (POCT), i.e. an examination performed near or at the site of a patient.

element.short: Laboratory observation model
element.definition: EHDS refined base model for Observation performed by laboratory

element.short: Laboratory test kit used during measurement.
element.definition: Laboratory test kit used during measurement.

element.definition: Information about which end-user calibrator the laboratory used for the measurement to indicate the metrological traceability chain.

element.definition: Accreditation status of the laboratory for the observation.

element.short: Previous results of the same observation
element.definition: Previous results of the same observation

element.definition: Indicates if the observation is a point-of-care test (POCT), i.e. an examination performed near or at the site of a patient.
